description: Copies the specified automated cluster snapshot to a new manual cluster snapshot. The source must be an automated snapshot and it must be in the available state. When you delete a cluster, Amazon Redshift deletes any automated snapshots of the cluster. Also, when the retention period of the snapshot expires, Amazon Redshift automatically deletes it. If you want to keep an automated snapshot for a longer period, you can make a manual copy of the snapshot. Manual snapshots are retained until you delete them. For more information about working with snapshots, go to Amazon Redshift Snapshots in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

parameters.name: SourceSnapshotIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the source snapshot. Constraints: Must be the identifier for a valid automated snapshot whose state is available.

parameters.name: SourceSnapshotClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the cluster the source snapshot was created from. This parameter is required if your IAM user has a policy containing a snapshot resource element that specifies anything other than * for the cluster name. Constraints: Must be the identifier for a valid cluster.

parameters.name: TargetSnapshotIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier given to the new manual snapshot. Constraints: Cannot be null, empty, or blank. Must contain from 1 to 255 alphanumeric characters or hyphens. First character must be a letter. Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens. Must be unique for the Amazon Web Services account that is making the request.

parameters.name: ManualSnapshotRetentionPeriod
parameters.description: The number of days that a manual snapshot is retained. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely. The value must be either -1 or an integer between 1 and 3,653. The default value is -1.

nested_items.name: SnapshotIdentifier
nested_items.description: The snapshot identifier that is provided in the request.

nested_items.name: ClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier of the cluster for which the snapshot was taken.

nested_items.name: SnapshotCreateTime
nested_items.description: The time (in UTC format) when Amazon Redshift began the snapshot. A snapshot contains a copy of the cluster data as of this exact time.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The snapshot status. The value of the status depends on the API operation used:
CreateClusterSnapshot and  CopyClusterSnapshot returns status as 'creating'.
DescribeClusterSnapshots returns status as 'creating', 'available', 'final snapshot', or 'failed'.
DeleteClusterSnapshot returns status as 'deleted'.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port that the cluster is listening on.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which the cluster was created.

nested_items.name: ClusterCreateTime
nested_items.description: The time (UTC) when the cluster was originally created.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: The admin user name for the cluster.

nested_items.name: ClusterVersion
nested_items.description: The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster.

nested_items.name: EngineFullVersion
nested_items.description: The cluster version of the cluster used to create the snapshot. For example, 1.0.15503.

nested_items.name: SnapshotType
nested_items.description: The snapshot type. Snapshots created using  CreateClusterSnapshot and  CopyClusterSnapshot are of type 'manual'.

nested_items.name: NodeType
nested_items.description: The node type of the nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: NumberOfNodes
nested_items.description: The number of nodes in the cluster.

nested_items.name: DBName
nested_items.description: The name of the database that was created when the cluster was created.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The VPC identifier of the cluster if the snapshot is from a cluster in a VPC. Otherwise, this field is not in the output.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: If true, the data in the snapshot is encrypted at rest.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Key Management Service (KMS) key ID of the encryption key that was used to encrypt data in the cluster from which the snapshot was taken.

nested_items.name: EncryptedWithHSM
nested_items.description: A boolean that indicates whether the snapshot data is encrypted using the HSM keys of the source cluster. true indicates that the data is encrypted using HSM keys.

nested_items.name: AccountsWithRestoreAccess
nested_items.description: A list of the Amazon Web Services accounts authorized to restore the snapshot. Returns null if no accounts are authorized. Visible only to the snapshot owner.

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: The identifier of an Amazon Web Services account authorized to restore a snapshot.

nested_items.name: AccountAlias
nested_items.description: The identifier of an Amazon Web Services support account authorized to restore a snapshot. For Amazon Web Services Support, the identifier is amazon-redshift-support.

nested_items.name: OwnerAccount
nested_items.description: For manual snapshots, the Amazon Web Services account used to create or copy the snapshot. For automatic snapshots, the owner of the cluster. The owner can perform all snapshot actions, such as sharing a manual snapshot.

nested_items.name: TotalBackupSizeInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: The size of the complete set of backup data that would be used to restore the cluster.

nested_items.name: ActualIncrementalBackupSizeInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: The size of the incremental backup.

nested_items.name: BackupProgressInMegaBytes
nested_items.description: The number of megabytes that have been transferred to the snapshot backup.

nested_items.name: CurrentBackupRateInMegaBytesPerSecond
nested_items.description: The number of megabytes per second being transferred to the snapshot backup. Returns 0 for a completed backup.

nested_items.name: EstimatedSecondsToCompletion
nested_items.description: The estimate of the time remaining before the snapshot backup will complete. Returns 0 for a completed backup.

nested_items.name: ElapsedTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The amount of time an in-progress snapshot backup has been running, or the amount of time it took a completed backup to finish.

nested_items.name: SourceRegion
nested_items.description: The source region from which the snapshot was copied.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The list of tags for the cluster snapshot.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key, or name, for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value for the resource tag.

nested_items.name: RestorableNodeTypes
nested_items.description: The list of node types that this cluster snapshot is able to restore into.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EnhancedVpcRouting
nested_items.description: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled. To create a cluster that uses enhanced VPC routing, the cluster must be in a VPC. For more information, see Enhanced VPC Routing in the Amazon Redshift Cluster Management Guide.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceTrackName
nested_items.description: The name of the maintenance track for the snapshot.

nested_items.name: ManualSnapshotRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days that a manual snapshot is retained. If the value is -1, the manual snapshot is retained indefinitely.

nested_items.name: ManualSnapshotRemainingDays
nested_items.description: The number of days until a manual snapshot will pass its retention period.

nested_items.name: SnapshotRetentionStartTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp representing the start of the retention period for the snapshot.

nested_items.name: MasterPasswordSecretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the cluster's admin user credentials secret.

nested_items.name: MasterPasswordSecretKmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Key Management Service (KMS) key used to encrypt and store the cluster's admin credentials secret.

nested_items.name: SnapshotArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot.
